intro: Leucopoa albida, commonly known as the white leucopoa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Leucopoa albida is typically found in coastal and sandy habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
